## Discussion

Each command buffer can be in any one of the following states:

The first two states ([doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBufferStatus/notEnqueued] and [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBufferStatus/enqueued]) both indicate that you can encode commands to the command buffer. You do this by creating an encoder that indirectly adds commands for a pass (see [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/command-encoder-factory-methods]) to the command buffer. Command buffers also have some methods that directly encode commands between passes, such as [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBuffer/encodeSignalEvent(_:value:)] and [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBuffer/present(_:)].

Each command buffer’s state can only change to a state below it in the table, and ends its life cycle at either [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBufferStatus/completed] or [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBufferStatus/error].

# status

**Instance Property**

The command buffer’s current state.

## Declaration

```swift
var status: MTLCommandBufferStatus { get }
```

## Discussion

Each command buffer can be in any one of the following states:



The first two states ([doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBufferStatus/notEnqueued] and [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBufferStatus/enqueued]) both indicate that you can encode commands to the command buffer. You do this by creating an encoder that indirectly adds commands for a pass (see [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/command-encoder-factory-methods]) to the command buffer. Command buffers also have some methods that directly encode commands between passes, such as [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBuffer/encodeSignalEvent(_:value:)] and [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBuffer/present(_:)].

Each command buffer’s state can only change to a state below it in the table, and ends its life cycle at either [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBufferStatus/completed] or [doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Metal/MTLCommandBufferStatus/error].

## Troubleshooting a command buffer

- **MTLCommandBufferStatus**: The discrete states for a command buffer that represent its life cycle stages.
- **Command buffer debugging**: Properties and methods for programmatically debugging runtime issues with a command buffer.
